Comment_13:
Sefaro is the son of Sayge from the dye
shop. He's a bit of a firebrand, but also
one of my brightest students.<sp:0:4:0>After class, he always selects a book to
read quietly by himself.<sp:0:4:0>He already reads at an adult level and
doesn't shy away from difficult subjects,
such as the Calamity.<sp:0:4:0>The family business has been booming
ever since Cece came to town, which may
make it hard for him to study at home.<sp:0:4:0>Sayge has an artisan's spirit and would
rather have his son helping out at the
store than going to school.<sp:0:4:0>But everyone learns differently. I want our
school to be a place where children can
get an education no matter their needs.
Comment_14:
I understand you'll be heading soon to
Hyrule Castle to investigate the reports
of strange phenomena there.<sp:0:4:0>I trust you'll be fine with Link at your side.
Nevertheless, I can't shake this strange
tightness in my chest.<sp:0:4:0>It's similar to what I felt right before the
Calamity, come to think of it.<sp:0:4:0>The children know you as Ms. Zelda,
their beloved teacher and mentor.<sp:0:4:0>But I know that Princess Zelda's duties
are wider-ranging than that. Take care,
Princess, and return to us soon.
Comment_10:
Karin is the only daughter of the mayor
and his wife. She's kind-hearted but shy,
and seems to lack self-confidence.<sp:0:4:0>She's very perceptive though. She has a
way of seeing right to the core of things.<sp:0:4:0>I'm sure you know, Princess, that Mayor
Reede has been breeding vegetables to
appeal to the younger generation.<sp:0:4:0>It was Karin who first noticed that her
peers were losing interest in produce.<sp:0:4:0>She figured this out based on nothing but
the number of customers and total items
in stock at the general store.<sp:0:4:0>I see her one day becoming a scholar to
rival Purah. Possibly even surpassing her!
Comment_09:
Aster is one of Medda's children. She's a
very active girl.<sp:0:4:0>I believe we have Medda to thank for that
charming bob cut she sports.<sp:0:4:0>She loves her father and always wants to
talk about his comings and goings.<sp:0:4:0>Lately, she's been especially focused on
the Hylian tomatoes Medda is growing.<sp:0:4:0>For a time, she seemed out of sorts after
Ms. Cece bought their house next to the
clothing shop.<sp:0:4:0>But she was back to her usual bright self
soon enough, noting that her new home is
cute, colorful, and "close to froggy."<sp:0:4:0>She has a real knack for finding the silver
lining in every situation!
Comment_11:
Azu is the brother of Ivee from the 
general store. But he'll tell you his true
identity is A-Zoom, the "big-time hero"!<sp:0:4:0>He and Sefaro used to be inseparable.<sp:0:4:0>But ever since the dye shop started
getting more clients, A-Zoom has been
left to patrol after school alone.<sp:0:4:0>Although his mother is Amira, one of the
town gossips, he keeps a close eye of his
own on the goings-on within the village.<sp:0:4:0>It may seem like simple child's play, but
people really do straighten up when they
know they're being watched.<sp:0:4:0>As long as he's on patrol, I think we have
nothing to fear in Hateno Village from any
would-be evildoers.
